front.title: Inter-Area IP Route Attribute in IS-IS

abstract.t: This document describes an extension to the IS-IS protocol to allow some routing attributes to be associated with advertised inter-area prefixes. The extension allows routers to learn this routing information without the knowledge of the link-state topology in another IS-IS level. The initial applications for this extension are inter-area IP MPLS fast reroute for node protection and inter-area TE LSPs.
